Description: Body sherd (mended from three fragments) of North Ionian pottery bowl; interior glazed (fired red-brown) with two added red bands lined in white; exterior: between bands with added red bands lined in white goat grazing to left (one hind leg missing; red dots on haunch and shoulder); simple rosettes as filling ornament; below, top of lower frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Kardara, Rodiaki Angeiographia 219, 2 and 218, fig. 188a. Very close to Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum 9565, though the firing inside is different.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.115)
